title: Eurostar Trains Back on Track After Tunnel Trouble
summary: Eurostar and Le Shuttle trains between the UK and France are running again after a big problem in the Channel Tunnel. On Tuesday, many trains were cancelled because of a power issue and a broken train that blocked the tracks. This caused long delays for thousands of passengers, especially those traveling for New Year's Eve. Repair workers fixed the problems overnight, so services started again on Wednesday morning. Eurostar says most trains are now running, but there might still be some delays or last-minute cancellations. Passengers should check the Eurostar website for updates before they travel. The company apologized and is offering refunds and vouchers to affected customers. Le Shuttle services are also mostly back to normal, with shorter delays in Calais.

background_read: The Channel Tunnel is a special tunnel that goes under the English Channel, allowing trains to travel between the UK and France. Eurostar is a popular train service that takes people quickly from London to cities like Paris, Brussels, and Amsterdam. Le Shuttle is another service that lets people drive their cars onto a train to go through the tunnel. Sometimes, problems like power failures or broken trains can cause big delays, affecting many travelers, especially during busy times like holidays.
